div.pre: 2030 Salve, near Lecce, Calabria, 1930 (900) Burial: late 3rd cent. B.C. (Crawford) Contents: 68+ AR Neapolis: 24 st. (mostly Sambon 436-80) Metapontum: 1 incuse st. (as Noe 258) Thurium: 1 st. (as SNGOxford 1065) Velia: 3 st. Caulonia: 1 st. Croton: 1 incuse st., (spread) Pegasi: 36 (Mesma 1, Anactorium 8, Argos 13,Koronta? 2, Metropolis 1, Thyr- rheium 11) Roman Rep.: 1 quadrig. Disposition: Taranto Breglia, AttiMemIIN 8 (1934), pp. 20-33, illus. Crawford, RRCH 64 The date of burial above is required by the presence of the quadrig., but since the hd. was first dispersed and then reassembled, its anomalous composi- tion is bound to be suspect. Neapolis, Velia, Thurium and the Pegasi form a reasonable early 3rd cent. nucleus; the quadrig. alone is much later; Meta- pontum, Caulonia and Croton very much earlier. The total absence of coins of Taras from a hd. of this area is surprising
